module.name: PostFixCalculator
module.short: Performs postfix calcuations based on a provided queue of operands and operators.

element.name: EUnknownOperatorError
element.short: Raised if an unknown operator is encountered.

element.name: EDivideByZeroError
element.short: Raised if division by zero is attempted.

element.name: TFloatStack
element.descr: Stack operations for floats. Intended to hold operands during postfix processing.

element.name: TFloatStack.Create
element.descr: Internally, the stack is represented by an array, initially of length two. As elements are added to the stack, the array is doubled each time the limits of the current array are reached.

element.name: TFloatStack.Size
element.short: Returns the number of elements in the stack.
element.descr: Returns the number of elements in the stack. An empty stack returns 0.

element.name: TFloatStack.Pop
element.short: Removes the top item from the stack and returns it.

element.name: TFloatStack.Push
element.short: Pushes the provided number onto the top of the stack.

element.name: TFloatStack.Peek
element.short: Returns the number at the top of the stack without removing it.

element.name: TFloatStack.IsEmpty
element.short: Returns true if the stack is empty, false otherwise.

element.name: TFloatStack.FCount
element.short: The number of elements currently in the stack.

element.name: TFloatStack.FLength
element.short: The length of the array used to hold the stack.

element.name: TFloatStack.FStackArray
element.short: The array the holds the stack.

element.name: TFloatStack.GrowArray
element.short: Double the size of the array used to hold the stack.
element.descr: Doubles the size of the array used to hold the stack. Each element in the current stack is copied to the new stack

element.name: TPostFixCalculator
element.short: Performs postfix calcuations based on a provided queue of operands and operators.

element.name: TPostFixCalculator.Create
element.descr: Creates a new calculator instance. In order to make use of the stored value from the previous calculation, it is recommended to only use one instance of this class. Creating a new instance for each calculation will reset the value of the previous result to 0.

element.name: TPostFixCalculator.Destroy
element.short: Destroys on the internally created and used stack that held the operands.

element.name: TPostFixCalculator.Calculate
element.short: Perform the postfix calculation and returns a double.

descr.p: Performs the postfix calculation and returns a double. The result of the previous calculation will be substitued for the @ symbol, if it is encountered. Errors will terminate the calculation without returning a numerical value.

ul.li: PostFixExpression - A queue of strings that holds the operands and operators in the proper order for performing postfix calculations. This queue will be emptied as part of the calculation process, but the caller is still responsible for mananaging the memory associated with the queue.

descr.p: Return - The result of the calculation, as a double.

errors.p: EUnknownOperatorError if an ununknown operator is encountered.
EDivideByZeroError if division by zero is attempted.
